data.title: Today's insider build prevents tasks from ending
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.15.0-insider Date 2017-07-25T07:30:52.414Z
- OS Version: Windows 10.0.14393

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Setup a task such as:
```
{
    "taskName": "MyTask",
    "command": "powershell.exe",
    "args": [
        "-Command",
        "& {...}"
    ],
    "presentation": {
        "reveal": "always",
        "panel": "shared"
    },
    "problemMatcher": []
}
```
2. Run the task, task fails to end.

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

If you cancel the task and try to run any powershell task, the following message is displayed "Terminal with ID 2 does not exist (has it already been disposed?)". Even shell commands fail to end, the task simply hangs.

Where are insider builds accumulated? I have no way to rollback a day when this worked?

data.title: Search and replace of a text only on selected code lines
data.body:
Sometimes I just need to find the keywords in some paragraphs of code, not in whole code.
It's useful just to select part of a text and find that I need

data.title: SCSS not suggesting nested tag completions
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.15.0-insider (fed03b66ac8acdac93897727a1d19ee0f6898bf2, 2017-07-25T07:20:25.274Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.7.0
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
ng-template|Ang|0.1.4
code-settings-sync|Sha|2.8.2
sort-lines|Tyr|1.3.0
html-snippets|abu|0.1.0
Bookmarks|ale|0.15.2
project-manager|ale|0.18.1
path-intellisense|chr|1.4.2
vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11
tslint|eg2|0.17.0
Angular2|joh|2.4.0
ecdc|mit|0.10.3
HTMLHint|mka|0.3.3
vscode-autoprefixer|mrm|2.0.0
vscode-stylefmt|mrm|2.4.1
angular2-inline|nat|0.0.17
stylelint|shi|0.28.0
change-case|wma|1.0.0

(4 theme extensions excluded)


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. if you type a tag at the root level of a SCSS file, it will suggest tags as expected.  Here it suggests `input`:

![screen shot 2017-07-25 at 9 05 41 am](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/835148/28573416-9654d644-7118-11e7-8a29-f65c52f43e05.png)

2. However, inside a nested selector, it forgets all about `input`:

![screen shot 2017-07-25 at 9 04 44 am](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/835148/28573454-b189b22c-7118-11e7-92d8-f960ff0f0916.png)

by nested selector, i mean

````
.my-outer-selector {
    input {
      color: green;
    }
}
`````

Same happens with every tag I've tried:  `button`, `div`, etc.

data.title: Show root folder name in tabs when same file name is opened in different group
data.body:
If I have two files with the same name from different root folders open, the root folder is displayed in the tab in grey, as well (there was an issue for this, but didn't found it):
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5795847/28571918-464c71ac-7145-11e7-9524-caa327f8b9c0.png)

Viewing one of this files on the side, the root folders are not displayed but should as well:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5795847/28572244-6fbe8e2a-7146-11e7-9092-91c0a25ead10.png)

cc #28344

data.title: Emmet: Number as a value isn't completed in multiple items
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:26:08.116Z) - OS Version: Linux x64 4.10.0-28-generic - Extensions: Extension|Author (truncated)|Version ---|---|--- codeception-snippets|die|0.0.4 githistory|don|0.2.2 php-debug|fel|1.11.1 php-intellisense|fel|1.4.3 AWK|lug|0.0.2 ftp-sync|luk|0.3.3 code-beautifier|mic|1.7.2 mads|mir|0.0.5 HTMLHint|mka|0.3.3 vscode-icons|rob|7.10.1 code-spell-checker|str|1.3.2 --- Steps to Reproduce: * Enter `table>tr>td{28}*2` and press `TAB` Expected result: ```html
28 28
``` Actual result: ```html
``` String works well: `table>tr>td{"28"}*2`: ```html
"28" "28"
``` Single item with number too: `table>tr>td{28}`: ```html
28
``` Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Git rename and move
data.body:
Is there a way (vscode natively or plugin) to make git file and folder move/rename command so that git doesn't consider my rename and move as deletion and addition of new file.

If not it would be good to add that feature.

data.title: [Feature Request] - Folder level settings for a workspace
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Insiders
- OS Version: Mac

I am experimenting with VS Code and have several python project folders setup in my workspace. Currently it doesn't seem possible to have folder level settings to specify different virtual environments to use for each folder as well as subfolder/file exclusion rules.

This is a common requirement where - in the case of having multiple python projects - each one has its own rules (virtualenv path to use, python version etc.)

data.title: Data in Text data type column gets truncated to 64,096 characters when copied
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.14.1
- OS Version: Mac OS X El Capitan 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a table with text column and insert a text of size greater than 64096 characters.
2. Select that row, copy the data in text column and paste it in Microsoft Word or somewhere else and count the number of characters. You will see that the number of characters got truncated to 64,096.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes/No

data.title: Explorer: Should alert confirm when folders moved
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:18:03.540Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.10.0-27-generic
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-emacs|hiro-sun|0.1.1|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  move a folder to some other folders
2.  no confirm shown.

expected:
1.  move a folder to some other folders
2.  show confirm dialog.
3. if confirmed => move folder
4. if cancelled => do nothing.

data.title: Multi-Cursor, Split Into Lines
data.body:
A feature that Sublime Text in particular makes particularly easy, is making a selection with the mouse and then hitting Ctrl+Shift+L, and each of the lines in the selection gets its own cursor. Which is a lot quicker than using the keyboard to one-by-one ad cursors in a line, and seems more intuitive.

This is particularly important is cases such as when the lines you want multiple cursors on are not sequential in the code. So it would be a lot easier to make multiple selections with the mouse, and then split those selections into cursors. 

This functionality is currently implemented by 2 extensions in the marketplace, I have tried both and they're clumsy and don't always work. First-party support seems to be the only solution.

data.title: Cannot contribute keybindings with arguments
data.body:
According to #14854, we support arguments when defining keybindings.
If we defining keybindings in the `keybindings.json`, it works well.
But when building my extension, I find that `args` field in `package.json` is not recognized and has no effect.

data.title: Can get already configured(preinstalled packages) vscode for the react native?
data.body:
Hi,
I need to install the packages and other setup for the react native app, like linter, automatic completion helpers etc.
Can get a version with the preinstalled modules for the developer? so no setup will be required.

data.title: Test multiroot api
data.body:
Test for: #28526

Complexity: 2

- [x] macOS - @weinand
- [x] Any OS - @sandy081

For the multi root effort we have added API to represent multiple workspaces. Make sure that the API reflects the workspace model properly and that it can be used successfully. Also make sure that the old, workspace-style methods like `asRelativePath` and `rootPath` still work. Write an extension that uses

* `vscode.workspace.workspaceFolders`
* `vscode.workspace.onDidChangeWorkspaceFolder`, and
* `vscode.workspace.getWorkspaceFolder` and more

data.title: Feature Request: "Scope to This"
data.body: This is not a bug, but a feature request. Most projects have many files and a deep file structure. Especially files at the top levels are rarely edited in TypeScript projects (lots von differenct json / config files). In the example screenshot, all the code editing happens in the marked area, the rest ist stuff I almost never edit: In full Visual Studio there is a feature to "Scope to This" in the Solution Explorer to virtually move the shown root folder to a sub-folder of the solution. It would be great to have the same functionality in VSCode - this way the user could concentrate on the files that actually matter most of the time.

data.title: Smoke test: Build Task is never terminated
data.body:
Repoted by todays smoke test (id: 30879)
OS: Windows

Steps to reproduce:
1. Clone https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-smoketest-express repo
2. Run build task
Observe that task is never terminated.

data.title: VSCode does not display some unicode characters
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.14.2 (https://aur.archlinux.org/packages/visual-studio-code)
- OS Version: Archlinux x64 (4.11.9-1-ARCH)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Paste this string ` ` into VSCode (not integrated terminal).
2. Observe that VSCode does not display these characters correctly - they are displayed as "empty squares". 

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

File is saved as UTF-8 encoded and VSCode shows UTF-8 at the bottom too. Strange thing is that I can copy this string in VSCode into clipboard and they are correct. My language in Arch is en-US with UTF-8 and since I can see this string correctly at least in Firefox and terminal, I don't think it is an issue with distro.

data.title: Adopt new configuration resolver service in tasks
data.body:
Due to the multi root work now the configuration resolver service needs to take in the workspace root uri when resolving variables.
This is needed for reolving variables like `${workspaceRoot}`

The tasks frameworks needs to adpot this, I have left TODO in the following places:
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/tasks/node/processRunnerDetector.ts#L176
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/tasks/node/processRunnerDetector.ts#L219
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/tasks/electron-browser/terminalTaskSystem.ts#L636
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/tasks/node/processTaskSystem.ts#L380

data.title: Callling .\vscode\scripts\code.bat --version does not print the version
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.15.0, commit b689bbe99ea8ecc602520ed8c8b775d46429bc4f
- OS Version: Windows 10 build 15063

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Compile VSCode from its source
2. Open a command line and run `.\vscode\scripts\code.bat --version`
3. VSCode will not print version and will open normally

It is expected to:

1. VSCode print its current version and exit, if there is not a VSCode instance running
1. VSCode print its current version and keep running, if there is a VSCode instance running

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5332158/28559531-45a3ef3a-70ed-11e7-8dc3-080b552718e6.png)


___ 

Update:

Calling it with `--help` also does not print help.

data.title: Error when saving files to OneDrive
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:34:09.706Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
platformio|for|0.2.2
cpptools|ms-|0.12.1
platformio-ide|pla|0.5.1
arduino-vscode|ste|0.2.2
vscode-arduino|vsc|0.2.4
debug|web|0.21.2

(3 theme extensions excluded)

Hi, I am storing all my source files on OneDrive so can easily sync and share across PC and Mac etc.
I find very regularly that I get an error when trying to save files - I get a file it locked or busy. I check on other devices and they are not open and in some cases and close OneDrive on all devices and sill same issue.

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Saving a file to OneDrive folder (issue occurs at random)
2.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Test: Token color customizations
data.body:
Tests #27894

- [x]  linux- **@joaomoreno**
- [x] windows - **@michelkaporin**

Complexity 2

Test the new setting "editor.tokenColorCustomizations" to modify the token colorization.
The colors and styles configured with this setting will override the color of the current theme.

- try `comments`, `strings`, `numbers`, `keywords`, `types`, `functions`, `variables` with a hex color (e.g. '#FF0000`) to modify the foreground of the given concepts
- try `textMateRules` to pass in an array text mate grammar rules
